title: Authors and Citation
text: Jasen Finch. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Finch J (2023). cheminf: Chemoinformatics Tools Annotating Untargeted ESI-MS Metabolomics Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://jasenfinch.github.io/cheminf/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cheminf: Chemoinformatics Tools For Annotating Untargeted ESI-MS Metabolomics Data},   author = {Jasen Finch},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://jasenfinch.github.io/cheminf/}, }

what: Chemoinformatics Tools For Annotating Untargeted ESI-MS Metabolomics Data
title: Chemoinformatics Tools For Annotating Untargeted ESI-MS Metabolomics Data
text: Chemoinformatics tools annotating untargeted ESI-MS metabolomics data

title: Chemoinformatics Tools For Annotating Untargeted ESI-MS Metabolomics Data
text: mzAnnotation package can installed GitHub using following:
code: remotes::install_github('jasenfinch/cheminf')

title: Chemoinformatics Tools For Annotating Untargeted ESI-MS Metabolomics Data
text: package documentation can browsed online https://jasenfinch.github.io/cheminf/. believe ’ve found bug cheminf, please file bug (, possible, reproducible example) https://github.com/jasenfinch/cheminf/issues.

title: MetaboliteDatabase S4 class — MetaboliteDatabase-class
text: S4 class metabolite electrospray ionisation database.

title: MetaboliteDatabase S4 class — MetaboliteDatabase-class
text: entries database metabolite entries descriptors chemical descriptors metabolite database entries

title: Example amino acids — amino_acids
text: chemical structures essential amino acids ID - identification number NAME - amino acid name InChI - InChI chemical structure InChIKey - InChIKey chemical structure SMILES - SMILES chemical structure

title: Example amino acids — amino_acids
code: amino_acids

title: Example amino acids — amino_acids
text: tibble containing 20 rows 6 columns.

title: Calculate chemical descriptors — chemicalDescriptors
text: Calculate chemical descriptors SMILES.

title: Calculate chemical descriptors — chemicalDescriptors
code: chemicalDescriptors(SMILES)

title: Calculate chemical descriptors — chemicalDescriptors
text: SMILES character vector valid SMILES

title: Calculate chemical descriptors — chemicalDescriptors
text: tibble containing chemical descriptor information input SMILES.

title: Convert chemical structure notation — convert
text: Convert SMILES InChI InchiKey chemical structure notations.

title: Convert chemical structure notation — convert
code: convert(   input,   input_type = c("SMILES", "INCHI"),   output_type = c("INCHI", "INCHIKEY", "SMILES") )

title: Convert chemical structure notation — convert
text: input valid SMILE InChI input_type either "SMILES" "INCHI", denoting input type output_type either "SMILES", "INCHI" "INCHIKEY", denoting output type

title: Convert chemical structure notation — convert
text: converted chemical structure.

title: Convert chemical structure notation — convert
text: functionality currently supported Windows.

title: Convert chemical structure notation — convert
code: if (Sys.info()["sysname"] != 'Windows'){   convert("C[C@H](C(=O)O)N",'SMILES','INCHI') } #> [1] "InChI=1S/C3H7NO2/c1-2(4)3(5)6/h2H,4H2,1H3,(H,5,6)/t2-/m1/s1"

what: Calculate ionisation products for a SMILES structure — ionisationProducts
title: Calculate ionisation products for a SMILES structure — ionisationProducts
text: Calculate electrospray ionisation product m/z SMILES structure.

title: Calculate ionisation products for a SMILES structure — ionisationProducts
code: ionisationProducts(SMILES, adduct_rules_table = adduct_rules())

title: Calculate ionisation products for a SMILES structure — ionisationProducts
text: SMILES valid SMILES string adduct_rules_table table adduct rules. Defaults adducts()

title: Calculate ionisation products for a SMILES structure — ionisationProducts
text: tibble containing mass charge ratios electrospray ionisation products specified SMILES structure.

title: Calculate ionisation products for a SMILES structure — ionisationProducts
code: ionisationProducts(amino_acids$SMILES[1]) #> # A tibble: 58 × 4 #>    Adduct         `m/z` MF         Possible #>    <chr>          <dbl> <chr>      <lgl>    #>  1 [M+3Na]3+       52.7 C3H7NNa3O2 TRUE     #>  2 [M+H+2Na]3+     45.3 C3H8NNa2O2 TRUE     #>  3 [M+2H+Na]3+     38.0 C3H9NNaO2  TRUE     #>  4 [M+3H]3+        30.7 C3H10NO2   TRUE     #>  5 [2M+3H2O+2H]2+ 117.  C6H22N2O7  TRUE     #>  6 [M+3ACN+2H]2+  107.  C9H18N4O2  TRUE     #>  7 [M+2ACN+2H]2+   86.6 C7H15N3O2  TRUE     #>  8 [M+2Na]2+       67.5 C3H7NNa2O2 TRUE     #>  9 [M+ACN+2H]2+    66.0 C5H12N2O2  TRUE     #> 10 [M+H+K]2+       64.5 C3H8KNO2   TRUE     #> # … with 48 more rows

what: Create a metabolite ionisation database — metaboliteDB
title: Create a metabolite ionisation database — metaboliteDB
text: Construct metabolite electrospray ionisation database.

title: Create a metabolite ionisation database — metaboliteDB
code: metaboliteDB(entries)

title: Create a metabolite ionisation database — metaboliteDB
text: entries tibble containing accession information. See details. table containing accession information within SQL database.

title: Create a metabolite ionisation database — metaboliteDB
text: object S4 class MetaboliteDatabase

title: Create a metabolite ionisation database — metaboliteDB
text: entries tibble contain least following columns: ID - Metabolite identification numbers NAME - Metabolite names SMILES - metabolite SMILES structures

title: Create a metabolite ionisation database — metaboliteDB
code: db <- metaboliteDB(amino_acids) db #>  #> MetaboliteDatabase object containing 20 entries #>

what: Ionisation product searches of a metabolite database — calcAdducts
title: Ionisation product searches of a metabolite database — calcAdducts
text: Methods metabolite database ionisation product searches

title: Ionisation product searches of a metabolite database — calcAdducts
code: calcAdducts(db, id, adduct_rules_table = adduct_rules())  # S4 method for MetaboliteDatabase calcAdducts(db, id, adduct_rules_table = adduct_rules())  PIPsearch(   db,   mz,   adduct,   ppm = 6,   isotope = NA,   adduct_rules_table = adduct_rules(),   isotope_rules_table = isotope_rules() )  # S4 method for MetaboliteDatabase PIPsearch(   db,   mz,   adduct,   ppm = 6,   isotope = NA,   adduct_rules_table = adduct_rules(),   isotope_rules_table = isotope_rules() )

title: Ionisation product searches of a metabolite database — calcAdducts
text: db S4 object class MetaboliteDatabase id Database entry ID adduct_rules_table table containing adduct formation rules. Defaults adduct_rules(). mz mass charge ratio search adduct search adduct available mzAnnotation::adduct_names() ppm parts per million error search threshold isotope search isotope available mzAnnotation::isotope_names() isotope_rules_table table containing isotope rules. Defaults isotope_rules().

title: Ionisation product searches of a metabolite database — calcAdducts
text: tibble containing relevant product search results depending method used.

title: Ionisation product searches of a metabolite database — calcAdducts
text: PIPsearch - perform putative ionisation product search metabolite database calcAdducts - calculate adduct mass charge ratios metabolite database entry

title: Ionisation product searches of a metabolite database — calcAdducts
code: metabolite_database <- metaboliteDB(amino_acids)  ## Perform a putative ionisation product search PIPsearch(   metabolite_database,   mz = 133.03358,   adduct = '[M-H]1-',   isotope = '13C') #> # A tibble: 1 × 12 #>      ID NAME   InChI InChI…¹ SMILES MF    Accur…² Isotope Adduct Measu…³ Theor…⁴ #>   <int> <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>    <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1     4 L-Asp… InCh… CKLJMW… C([C@… C4H7…    133. 13C     [M-H]…    133.    133. #> # … with 1 more variable: `PPM Error` <dbl>, and abbreviated variable names #> #   ¹​InChIKey, ²​Accurate_Mass, ³​`Measured m/z`, ⁴​`Theoretical m/z`  ## Calculate adduct m/z for a database entry calcAdducts(metabolite_database,1) #> # A tibble: 58 × 4 #>    Adduct         `m/z` MF         Possible #>    <chr>          <dbl> <chr>      <lgl>    #>  1 [M+3Na]3+       52.7 C3H7NNa3O2 TRUE     #>  2 [M+H+2Na]3+     45.3 C3H8NNa2O2 TRUE     #>  3 [M+2H+Na]3+     38.0 C3H9NNaO2  TRUE     #>  4 [M+3H]3+        30.7 C3H10NO2   TRUE     #>  5 [2M+3H2O+2H]2+ 117.  C6H22N2O7  TRUE     #>  6 [M+3ACN+2H]2+  107.  C9H18N4O2  TRUE     #>  7 [M+2ACN+2H]2+   86.6 C7H15N3O2  TRUE     #>  8 [M+2Na]2+       67.5 C3H7NNa2O2 TRUE     #>  9 [M+ACN+2H]2+    66.0 C5H12N2O2  TRUE     #> 10 [M+H+K]2+       64.5 C3H8KNO2   TRUE     #> # … with 48 more rows

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
title: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. magrittr %>%

title: SMARTS substructure search — smartsSearch
text: Perform SMARTS substructure searches SMILES chemical structure.

title: SMARTS substructure search — smartsSearch
code: smartsSearch(SMILES, SMARTS)

title: SMARTS substructure search — smartsSearch
text: SMILES valid SMILES structure string SMARTS valid SMARTS symbol

title: SMARTS substructure search — smartsSearch
text: number SMARTS matches.

title: SMARTS substructure search — smartsSearch
code: smartsSearch("C[C@H](C(=O)O)N","[OX2H]") #> [1] 1

what: Convert a SMILES structure to a molecular formula or accurate mass — smilesToMF
title: Convert a SMILES structure to a molecular formula or accurate mass — smilesToMF
text: Convert SMILES structure molecular formula accurate mass.

title: Convert a SMILES structure to a molecular formula or accurate mass — smilesToMF
code: smilesToMF(SMILES)  smilesToAccurateMass(SMILES)

title: Convert a SMILES structure to a molecular formula or accurate mass — smilesToMF
text: SMILES valid SMILES structure string

title: Convert a SMILES structure to a molecular formula or accurate mass — smilesToMF
code: ## Convert a SMILES structure to a molecular formula smilesToMF("C[C@H](C(=O)O)N") #> [1] "C3H7NO2"  ## Convert a SMILES structure to an accurate mass smilesToAccurateMass("C[C@H](C(=O)O)N") #> [1] 89.04767847

title: Metabolite database utility methods — entries
text: Utilities working metabolite databases.

title: Metabolite database utility methods — entries
code: entries(db)  # S4 method for MetaboliteDatabase entries(db)  descriptors(db)  # S4 method for MetaboliteDatabase descriptors(db)  nEntries(db)  # S4 method for MetaboliteDatabase nEntries(db)  filterMR(db, lower, upper)  # S4 method for MetaboliteDatabase filterMR(db, lower, upper)  filterER(db, rule)  # S4 method for MetaboliteDatabase filterER(db, rule)  filterIP(db, rule)  # S4 method for MetaboliteDatabase filterIP(db, rule)  filterEntries(db, IDs)  # S4 method for MetaboliteDatabase filterEntries(db, IDs)  filterMF(db, mf)  # S4 method for MetaboliteDatabase filterMF(db, mf)

title: Metabolite database utility methods — entries
text: db S4 object class MetaboliteDatabase lower lower mass boundary upper upper mass boundary rule filtering expression IDs numeric vector entry IDs mf molecular formula filter

title: Metabolite database utility methods — entries
text: tibble containing metabolite entry information, number metabolite entires S4 object class MetaboliteDatabase depending method used.

title: Metabolite database utility methods — entries
text: entries - return metabolite entries descriptors - return metabolite entry chemical descriptors nEntries - return number metabolite entries filterEntries - filter metabolite entries based vector metabolite IDs filterMR - filter metabolite entries based mass range filterER - filter metabolite entries based element frequency rule filterIP - filter metabolite entries based ionisation product rule filterMF - filter metabolite entries based molecular formula

title: Metabolite database utility methods — entries
code: ## Create a metablite ionisation database using the example amino acid data metabolite_database <- metaboliteDB(amino_acids)  ## Return the entries entries(metabolite_database) #> # A tibble: 20 [1] 20  ## Filter database entries filterEntries(metabolite_database,c(1:5)) #>  #> MetaboliteDatabase object containing 5 entries #>   ## Filter database using a mass range filterMR(metabolite_database,100,120) #>  #> MetaboliteDatabase object containing 4 entries #>   ## Filter the database by an element frequency rule filterER(metabolite_database,C > 2) #>  #> MetaboliteDatabase object containing 0 entries #>   ## Filter the database by an ionisation product rule filterIP(metabolite_database,HBA2>0 & Total_Charge==0) #>  #> MetaboliteDatabase object containing 20 entries #>   ## Filter a database by a molecular formula filterMF(metabolite_database,"C3H7NO2") #>  #> MetaboliteDatabase object containing 1 entries #>

title: cheminf 0.1.0
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added chemical structure (SMILES, InChI) chemoinformatics functionality based OpenBabel mzAnnotation package. ChemmineOB package now used interfacing OpenBabel functionality.
